document_title: Skin cancer: Signs, causes and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Skin cancer is a condition in which skin cells grow out of control. This is a common disease and tends to be more frequent in white people. Black people and people of color have a lower incidence.
The incidence of malignant skin cancer is related primarily to sun exposure or a history of sunburn. These are factors and risks that can be changed. It is important that each individual should be aware of prevention early to avoid contracting this disease.
See more: 5 stages of skin cancer: How to evaluate and diagnose in detail.
